page.title: 05SEWERBY HALL
page.content: Sewerby Hall is a beautiful Georgian stately house that has been added to in recent years. It stands amongst colourful gardens and extensive parkland. Once a private residence, it is now owned by East Yorkshire Borough Council and is open as a leisure amenity. The house contains an art gallery, museum & the area teachers' centre. The art gallery contains no famous paintings but some fine works, several by local artists. Each year the gallery accommodates the local art exhibition. The museum is divided into natural history, archeology which consists of finds from the surrounding area & the Amy Johnson room, which contains exhibits & memorabilia of the famous woman air pilot. The teachers' centre contains information & study packs for local teachers and visiting schools.
